intro: Apocopis borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean apocopis, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of Borneo. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweed and related plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves that are often hairy. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, with showy petals that attract pollinators. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
